page.title: 05Sunday for a village boy.
page.content: Keith is a little boy who lives in the village of Ellastone in a white little cottage with his parents and sister. On a typical Sunday Keith gets up at 8.30am. He has breakfast. Then he might go for a ride on his pony. After he helps his dad do the gardening or grease his lorry. Then it's lunchtime. He has potatoes, greens, gravy, meat. After dinner he plays on his own. He has salad for tea and goes to bed at 8.30pm. There are very few children in the village and Keith gets lonely. The thing he likes doing most in the world is playing football. His favourite food is chips and thick soup. Keith gets taken to school by taxi. His parents say he is an aggravating child who likes to torment everybody. He is full of mischief but loveable.
